page.title: 04MID-HANTS RAILWAY ALRESFORD
page.content: {The Mid-Hampshire Railway} was opened in 1865. Early services ran from London to Southampton. It was nicknamed the Watercress Line due to its links with the watercress growing nearby. A decline in passengers and freight caused its closure in 1973.However, it was reopened as a privately preserved line in 1977 between Alresford and Ropley and extended in 1985 to Alton,in all about 10 miles. Now the nostalgia of Steam can be enjoyed by all, as we remember the hiss of steam, the rhythm of the wheels over jointed track. It is a record of days gone by, leisurely and orderly , a slice of rural heritage. It costs #2.95 for adults and #1.50 for children, return. The Railway is run by volunteer staff.
